column1: Poissy (French: [pwasi] (listen)) is a commune in the Yvelines department in the Île-de-France in north-central France. It is located in the western suburbs of Paris
column2: 23.8 km (14.8 mi) from the centre of Paris. Inhabitants are called Pisciacais.

column1: In 1561 it was the site of a fruitless Catholic-Huguenot conference
column2: the Colloquy of Poissy. It is known for hosting successively the Automobiles Gregoire
column8: and now hosts one of France's largest Peugeot factories. The "Simca Poissy engine" was made here.

column1: Poissy is served by Poissy station on Paris RER line A and on the Transilien Paris – Saint-Lazare suburban rail line.
Technoparc is a Business Park created in 1990
column2: with the intention to facilitate the economic diversification of the city. It occupies about 66 acres on the northeast of PSA Peugeot Citroën factory
column3: bordering the neighbouring commune Achères. The Park welcomes 150 companies employing a total of 2
column4: 000 employees. It also hosts The Charles-de-Gaulle High School and The Training Centre for the Employees in Pharmacy (ACPPAV) gathering 1
column5: 500 high school students and students. Two business incubator
column7: the Chamber of Commerce of Yvelines-Val d'Oise
column9: a sports centre and a municipal technical centre are also located there.
